title: Trump extends deadline to keep TikTok running in US
snippets: The president has granted the app a second 75-day extension to comply with a law that requires it to either sell its US assets or face a ban.
summary: The president has issued a second 75-day extension for an app to meet the requirements of a law mandating it to sell its US assets or be banned. This decision allows the app additional time to comply with the legislation.
titles: Trump extends deadline to keep TikTok running in US

title: Trump again extends deadline for TikTok sale to avoid US ban
snippets: President Donald Trump pauses enforcement of law requiring Bytedance to divest from TikTok or face ban in the US.
summary: President Donald Trump has temporarily halted the enforcement of a law that would require Bytedance, the parent company of TikTok, to sell its US operations or face a ban in the United States.
titles: Trump again extends deadline for TikTok sale to avoid US ban

title: Worst week for US stocks since Covid crash as China hits back on tariffs
snippets: The US president, who has vowed to remake the global trade order, dismissed concerns, noting the US jobs market is strong.
summary: The US president dismissed concerns about his plans to overhaul the global trade order, citing the strength of the US jobs market as evidence.
titles: Worst week for US stocks since Covid crash as China hits back on tariffs

title: Trump's agenda grapples with political and economic reality
snippets: Trump says it’s all going to plan but stock market turmoil plus struggles at home and abroad show how hard it is to deliver as president.
summary: Former President Donald Trump claimed that his strategies were unfolding as planned, despite facing challenges reflected in stock market instability and various domestic and international difficulties. These issues highlight the complexities and challenges of fulfilling presidential duties.
titles: Trump's agenda grapples with political and economic reality

title: Children among 18 killed in Russian attack on Zelensky's home city
snippets: The head of the city defence council says a ballistic missile hit a residential area, killing children on a playground.
summary: A ballistic missile struck a residential area, targeting a playground and resulting in the deaths of children. This information was confirmed by the head of the city defence council.
titles: Children among 18 killed in Russian attack on Zelensky's home city

title: Breaking down all four women's Final Four teams -- and predicting the 2025 national champion
snippets: No. 1 seeds UCLA, South Carolina and Texas advanced to Tampa. But 2-seed UConn has momentum and experience.
summary: No. 1 seeds UCLA, South Carolina, and Texas progressed to Tampa in the tournament. Meanwhile, 2-seed UConn, noted for its momentum and experience, also advanced.
titles: Breaking down all four women's Final Four teams -- and predicting the 2025 national champion

title: Pirates fall to Yankees in opener; fans hit breaking point, loudly rip Nutting
snippets: Outside home runs from Bryan Reynolds and Ke’Bryan Hayes, the only time fans of the Pittsburgh Pirates showed genuine enthusiasm in a 9-4 home opener loss to the New York Yankees was to say one thing.
summary: In the Pittsburgh Pirates' home opener, they were defeated by the New York Yankees with a score of 9-4. Despite the loss, Pirates fans showed enthusiasm during the game, notably for home runs hit by Bryan Reynolds and Ke’Bryan Hayes. These moments were highlights for Pirates supporters in an otherwise disappointing game.
titles: Pirates fall to Yankees in opener; fans hit breaking point, loudly rip Nutting

title: With Gretzky on hand, Ovechkin scores 893rd
snippets: Capitals star Alex Ovechkin scored his 893rd career goal Friday night against the Blackhawks to move one back of tying and two away from breaking Wayne Gretzky's NHL record.
summary: Alex Ovechkin, a player for the Capitals, scored his 893rd career goal during a game against the Blackhawks on Friday night. This achievement places him just one goal away from tying and two goals away from surpassing Wayne Gretzky's NHL record for career goals.
titles: With Gretzky on hand, Ovechkin scores 893rd

title: Sources: Texas A&M to hire Samford's McMillan
snippets: Samford's Bucky McMillan is set to take over for Buzz Williams as Texas A&M's men's basketball coach, with the two sides finalizing a five-year deal, sources told ESPN.
summary: Bucky McMillan has been appointed as the new men's basketball coach for Texas A&M, replacing Buzz Williams. The agreement between McMillan and the university is a five-year deal, as confirmed by sources to ESPN.
titles: Sources: Texas A&M to hire Samford's McMillan

title: Buffs coach: Stars 'should be going 1-2' in draft
snippets: Deion Sanders says quarterback Shedeur Sanders and Heisman Trophy winner Travis Hunter -- the marquee players of Friday's Colorado Showcase -- have confirmed that they are the top two players in this year's NFL draft.
summary: Deion Sanders stated that quarterback Shedeur Sanders and Heisman Trophy winner Travis Hunter, both featured in the Colorado Showcase, are the top two players in this year's NFL draft. This assertion highlights their prominence and skill level within the draft pool.
titles: Buffs coach: Stars 'should be going 1-2' in draft

title: Hedge funds hit with steepest margin calls since 2020 Covid crisis
snippets: Banks ask clients to stump up additional money as global market sell-off knocks value of holdings
summary: Banks have requested their clients to provide additional funds due to a global market sell-off that has decreased the value of their holdings. This action is a response to the financial impact caused by the downturn in global markets.
titles: Hedge funds hit with steepest margin calls since 2020 Covid crisis

title: How Massive Are Trump's Tariffs? Here Are 3 Graphs That Explain
snippets:
President Donald Trump made seismic shifts to U.S. trade this week that could have long-term effects on the economy and your pocketbook.

On Wednesday, Trump announced a 10% base tariff and additional import taxes on a country-by-country basis. These broad-based tariffs are in addition to goods-specific tariffs on steel, aluminum, and automobiles. The president said that the tariffs are designed to bring manufacturing and business investment back into the country while raising revenue for the federal government.

To quantify the magnitude of these changes, here are three graphs that help explain the new tariff policies.

This Is the Highest Effective Tariff Rate in More Than a Century

The effective tariff rate measures the total taxes levied on imports. It's a good way to account for all tariff policies that a country has in place.

In the U.S., that rate was 2.4% when Trump took office earlier this year. Economists have worked to enumerate the average effective rate after the announcement of "reciprocal" tariffs this week and have used different calculations, with most ranging between 20% and 30%.

According to researchers at the Yale Budget Lab this week, the effective tariff rate will rise to more than 22% when all the tariff measures announced are enacted. That includes the 11.5% that stems from the new tariffs unveiled this week and is the highest since 1909.

Prices on Goods Will Likely Increase

Most economists agree that tariffs will increase the price of goods for average Americans.

Because importers are being taxed at a higher level when goods are shipped into the country, they often pass on those increased costs to consumers. Yale Budget Lab estimates that, in total, tariffs could cost the typical household $3,800 per year.

However, some items will cost more than others, with leather goods and clothes expected to experience the highest increases.

The Impacts of Tariffs Could Be Felt for a Long Time

In addition to pushing up prices, economists said the tariffs could slow the economy's growth and raise the chances of a recession.

Trump has said he's prepared for temporary pain as the global economy adjusts to his new policies. However, economists think the effects could be long-lasting. According to the Budget Lab, tariffs could drag on the country's gross domestic product (GDP) for years to come.
summary: President Donald Trump introduced significant changes to U.S. trade policies, announcing a 10% base tariff along with additional country-specific import taxes, including on steel, aluminum, and automobiles. This move, aimed at boosting domestic manufacturing and government revenue, is expected to increase the effective tariff rate in the U.S. to over 22%, the highest since 1909. Economists predict these tariffs will raise the cost of goods for American consumers, potentially costing the average household $3,800 annually and leading to higher prices, particularly for leather goods and clothes.
titles: How Massive Are Trump's Tariffs? Here Are 3 Graphs That Explain

title: US stocks shed $5.4tn in two days as Trump’s tariffs stoke recession fears
snippets: China’s retaliation against Washington’s levies adds to sense of gloom across global markets
summary: China has responded to Washington's tariffs by imposing its own, leading to increased pessimism in global financial markets. This tit-for-tat trade action contributes to a growing sense of economic uncertainty worldwide.
titles: US stocks shed $5.4tn in two days as Trump’s tariffs stoke recession fears

title: Meloni under pressure to back EU ‘bazooka’ against Trump tariffs
snippets: Italy will effectively have casting vote on whether to support use of anti-coercion instrument to hit US services exports
summary: Italy holds a decisive role in determining whether to endorse the use of an anti-coercion instrument targeting US services exports. This position gives Italy significant influence over the decision-making process on this matter.
titles: Meloni under pressure to back EU ‘bazooka’ against Trump tariffs

title: Canada and Mexico leaders take credit for dodging latest US tariffs
snippets: Washington’s two biggest trade partners still face a host of levies from their neighbour
summary: Washington's two major trade partners are currently subjected to numerous tariffs imposed by the United States. Despite ongoing discussions and negotiations, these levies remain in place, affecting trade relations.
titles: Canada and Mexico leaders take credit for dodging latest US tariffs

title: Artificial intelligence has potential to aid physician decisions during virtual urgent care
snippets: Do physicians or artificial intelligence (AI) offer better treatment recommendations for patients examined through a virtual urgent care setting? A new study shows physicians and AI models have distinct strengths. The study compared initial AI treatment recommendations to final recommendations of physicians who had access to the AI recommendations but may or may not have reviewed them.
summary: A new study comparing treatment recommendations in a virtual urgent care setting found that physicians and AI models each have unique strengths. It examined how initial AI-generated treatment suggestions compared to the final decisions made by physicians, who had the option to review the AI recommendations. The study highlights the distinct roles both AI and physicians play in patient care decisions.
titles: Artificial intelligence has potential to aid physician decisions during virtual urgent care

title: Hot Schrödinger cat states created
snippets: Quantum states can only be prepared and observed under highly controlled conditions. A research team has now succeeded in creating so-called hot Schrodinger cat states in a superconducting microwave resonator. The study shows that quantum phenomena can also be observed and used in less perfect, warmer conditions.
summary: A research team has successfully created hot Schrodinger cat states in a superconducting microwave resonator, demonstrating that quantum phenomena can be observed and utilized in warmer, less controlled conditions than previously thought.
titles: Hot Schrödinger cat states created

title: Novel genomic screening tool enables precision reverse-engineering of genetic programming in cells
snippets: Collaborative research defines a novel approach to understanding how certain proteins called transcription factors determine which genetic programs will drive cell growth and maturation. The method, called 'Perturb-multiome,' uses CRISPR to knock out the function of individual transcription factors across many blood cells at once. The researchers then perform single-cell analyses on each cell to measure the effects of the editing, including identifying which genes have been turned on or off and which genes are accessible (based on epigenetic markers).
summary: Researchers have developed 'Perturb-multiome,' a method using CRISPR to simultaneously edit transcription factors in blood cells to study their role in gene regulation. This technique allows for single-cell analyses to observe gene activation, deactivation, and accessibility changes. This novel approach advances understanding of genetic programs influencing cell growth and maturation.
titles: Novel genomic screening tool enables precision reverse-engineering of genetic programming in cells

title: Century-old clues reveal hidden threat to Australian songbird
snippets: A hidden threat facing one of Australia's most iconic birds has been uncovered in a new study. The critically endangered regent honeyeater once numbered in the hundreds of thousands, but their population has dwindled to fewer than 300. By analysing the DNA of museum specimens more than 100 years old and comparing it to modern samples, the team discovered that despite a population decline of 99 per cent, this has not been entirely mirrored by genetics. The bird has lost 9 per cent of its genetic diversity.
summary: A study reveals that the critically endangered regent honeyeater, with a population now under 300 from hundreds of thousands, has lost 9% of its genetic diversity despite a 99% population decline. Researchers compared DNA from over 100-year-old museum specimens to modern samples, uncovering this hidden threat to one of Australia's iconic birds.
titles: Century-old clues reveal hidden threat to Australian songbird

title: A Leap in viral research: More sensitive viral RNA detection
snippets: Researchers have unveiled innovative, label-free ratiometric fluorosensor designed for the selective and sensitive detection of enteroviral RNA. The research promises to deliver even more advanced and effective detection methods, reinforcing the importance of interdisciplinary collaboration in addressing global health challenges.
summary: Researchers have developed a new label-free ratiometric fluorosensor for the selective and sensitive detection of enteroviral RNA. This advancement highlights the crucial role of interdisciplinary collaboration in enhancing global health by promising more effective detection methods for enteroviruses.
titles: A Leap in viral research: More sensitive viral RNA detection
